KUOM, U. of Minnesota

PRESIDENT
SEYMOUR N. SIEGEL
WNYC, Municipal Broadcasting System
2500 Municipal Building
New York 7, N. Y.
January 23, 1952
Mr. James Miles
Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Jim:
You will recall that at the meeting last weekend
authorization was provided for the expenditure of NALB funds
to subscribe for Television Digest so that I would be able to
use it as a source of information in editing the News-Letter,
would you be so kind as to put through a requisition for it,
requesting that it be addressed to me here at KUOM.
I received in the mail today notice of the January edition
of their TV Factbook, which I presume would be distributed to
regular subscribers. I wonuer if in placing the order you would
request the subscription to include this.
It also happens that my HA&B subscription to Variety and
Billboard have run out. I must say that 1 have not found
Billboard helpful enough to justify its purchase from our funds,
but I would like very much to have Variety continued. If you
can properly do so would you requisition a Variety subscription
for me too?
Your telegram Ccrae this morning relative to the meeting in
Lafayette on February 7, 3 and 9. You can count on me to be
there. I assume Lawson was included in this and accordingly
have checked with him; he will be able to make it too.
Yours sincerely.
Burton psulu
Secretary and Publications editor
Bp/arp
Copy to Seymour Siegel
Frank Schooley
Representing non-commercial, educational, radio and television stations, workshops, and production
centers, owned and operated by colleges, universities, school systems and public-service agencies.
